column1: The liquid part of your blood without cells (serum) is mixed with blood that is known to be type A and type B.
Persons with type A blood have anti-B antibodies, and those with type B blood have anti-A antibodies.
That is why people with type O blood are called universal blood donors.
If the father has Rh+ blood, the mother needs to receive a treatment to help prevent the development of substances that may harm the unborn baby.
